gurmukhi: pRwq Bey jmnw jl mY imil Dwie geI sBhI gupIAw ]imil gwvq gIq clI iqh jwkir AwnMd Bw mn mY kupIAw ]
transliteration: Praat Bhae Jamnaa Jal Mai Mil(i) Dhaae Gadsabh-higoupeeaa|| Mil(i) Gadvat Geel Chalijaakar(i) Aanand Bhaa Man Mai Koupeeaa||
translation: Early in the morning all the gopis went towards yamuna; they were singing songs and seeing them in bliss, ‘the bliss’ also seemed to be in anger;

gurmukhi: qb hI Puin kwnH cly iqh jw jmunw jl ko Pun jw jupIAw soaU dyK qbY Bgvwn khY nih bolhu rI kirho cupIAw ]250]

transliteration: Tah Hiphoun(i) Kaahn Chale Tih Jaa Jamounnda Jal Ko Phoun Jaa Joupeeaa|| Sooo Dekh Tabai Bhagvaan Kahai Nah(i) Boloh Rikariho Choupeeaa||250||
translation: Then Krishna also went towards Yamuna and seeing the gopis, he said to them, “Why do you not speak? And why are you keeping silent?”250.
Now begins the description about the removal of clothes

gurmukhi: nHwvn lwig jbY gupIAw qb lY pt kwn crXo qr aUpY ]qau muskXwn lgI mD Awpn koie pukwr kry hir jU pY ]
transliteration: Nhaavan Laag(i) Jabai Goupeeaa Tah Lai Pat Kaan Cdaryo Tar Oopai|| Tau Mouskyaan Lagee Madh Aapan Kod Poukar Dare Hari Ju Pe ||
translation: When the gopis began to take bath, Krishna ascended the tree taking away their clothes; the gopis smiled and some of them shouted and said to him:

gurmukhi: cIr hry hmry Cl so qumso Tg nwih ikDo koaU BUpY ]hwQn swQ su swrI hrI diRg swQ hro hmro qum rUpY ]251]
transliteration: Cheer Dare Hamre Chhal So Toumso Thag Naah(i) Kidho Ko( i)  Bhoopai|| Haathan Saath Su Saaridrig Saath Daro Hamro Toum Roopai||251||
translation: “You have fraudulently stolen our clothes, there is no other thug like you; You have taken away our clothes with your hands and you are capturing our beauty with your eyes.”251.
Speech of the gopis addressed to Krishna:

gurmukhi: sXwm khXo muK qy gupIAw ieh kwnH isKy qum bwq BlI hY ]nMd kI Er ipKo qumhUM idKo BRwq kI Er ik nwm hlI hY ]
transliteration: Syaam Kahyo Moukh Te Goupeeaa Eh Kaahn Sikhe Toum Baat Bhalihai|| Nand Kior Pikho Toumhoon Dikho Bhraat Ki Or Ki Naam Halihai||
translation: Gopis said, “O Krishna! you have learnt this good (for nothing) job; You may see towards Nand, see towards you brother Balram;

gurmukhi: cIr hry hmry Cl soN suin mwr frY quih kMs blI hY ]ko mr hY hmko qumro niRp qor frYN ijm kaul klI hY ]252]
transliteration: Cheer Dare Hamre Chhal Son Soun(i) Maar Darai Tuh(i) Kans Balihai|| Ko Mar Hai Hamko Toumro Nrip Tor Darain Jim Kaul Kalihai||252||
translation: When Kansa will know of it that you have stolen our clothes, then that mighty one will kill you; none will say anything to us; the king will pluck you like the lotus.”252.
Speech of Krishna addressed to gopis:
